title: Ticket #4223: "condor_q -userlog" takes write locks
description:
We noticed that a CMS schedd had load 100 without any apparent contention for disk or CPU, yet many "condor_q" were stuck for several minutes on "D" state.

It seems that "condor_q -userlog" takes write locks on a record-by-record basis in the user log; having many invocations going concurrently seems to cause everything to muck up and go slowly. In this case, I observe 10 minutes to read through a modestly-sized log.

For reading the file, is a read-lock possible? Or, better yet, no lock at all?
remarks:
2014-Mar-08 08:10:26 by bbockelm:
As a work-around, setting: 

ENABLE_USERLOG_LOCKING=false

for just the condor_q process seems to avoid any locking at all.

Still an inordinate amount of fseek / lseek...
